title: Red Sox playoff picture: Thursday’s loss to Jays means no postseason clinch … yet
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox will have another chance to clinch a playoff spot on Friday with a win over Detroit or an Astros loss.
Brayan Bello and the Red Sox came up short against the Blue Jays on Thursday.
Chris Young/The Canadian Press via AP By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 3 minutes to read The Red Sox will have to wait at least another day before they can potentially clinch a spot in the playoffs.

title: Worcester married couple convicted of sex trafficking, conspiracy
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The husband and wife could face up to life in prison for sex trafficking and conspiracy after a jury found them guilty Monday.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A Worcester married couple was convicted of sex trafficking Monday after a six-day jury trial, federal prosecutors said.

title: Man arrested in 1973 Conn. murder of young woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Crime George Legere, 77, was arrested in prison on a warrant for the murder of 21-year-old Janet Couture, who was murdered in her home Oct.
East Hartford Police Department A cold case homicide of a 21-year-old woman was closed 52 years later with the arrest of a Connecticut man Wednesday, police said Thursday.

title: Free museum days program for Boston students expands to include performing arts
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Boston students can now score free tickets to the Boston Ballet, Boston Symphony Orchestra, and other performing art institutions.
The Boston Family Days program is expanding to include free access for Boston students at nearly a dozen performing arts venues.

Jessica Rinaldi/The Boston Globe Boston students and their families will now have free access to live performances at some of the city’s premier venues as part of the Boston Family Days program, Mayor Michelle Wu announced.

title: 3 takeaways from Day 8 of Bruins training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins Bruins forwards like Johnny Beecher and Fabian Lysell could be on the roster bubble.
Johnny Beecher could be on the roster bubble with Boston.
John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 5 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Massive fire at Vermont ski resort destroys clubhouse, pub
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Despite the devastating damage, the resort said it intends to keep the golf club running for the remainder of the season.
Sugarbush Resort in Vermont was ravaged by a devastating fire Wednesday night.
Sugarbush Resort A clubhouse and pub at the Sugarbush Resort in Warren, Vermont were destroyed by a raging fire Wednesday night, causing irreparable damage.

title: Boston’s South Station Tower finally opens its doors
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News The $1.
5 billion project has been in the works since 1998.
Construction of South Station Tower continues in Boston, MA.

title: 5 takeaways from Celtics press conference with new ownership group
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics “I want a third ring, and then I want a fourth one.
" Bill Chisholm and the Celtics' new ownership group fielded questions from the media on Thursday.

Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 | 7:29 PM 9 minutes to read A little over a month after the sale of the Celtics was completed, new lead owner Bill Chisholm, co-owner/alternate governor Aditya Mittal, CEO Wyc Grousbeck, President Rich Gotham and president of basketball operations Brad Stevens addressed the media on Thursday afternoon at the Auerbach Center.

title: Charges dropped against Falmouth 18-year-old accused of planning school shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The "suspicious" male seen at a local elementary school was actually not Fotheringham, according to his lawyer.

By Molly Farrar September 25, 2025 | 7:06 PM 1 minute to read Prosecutors dropped the charges against an 18-year-old accused of threatening to “shoot up” a Cape Cod school and showing up at an elementary school last month, officials said.
Ian Fotheringham, of Falmouth, was initially charged with threatened use of a deadly weapon in a public building.

title: What Brad Stevens said about Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "The most important thing is a fully healthy Jayson Tatum.
” Jayson Tatum suffered a torn Achilles four months ago.

Barry Chin/The Boston Globe By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 | 6:28 PM 2 minutes to read Jayson Tatum was staring at a long road back to the hardwood in May after he ruptured his Achilles tendon during the Eastern Conference Semifinals against the Knicks.
